validation_notes: All 10 required XML sections present: metadata, overview, technology_stack, coding_standards, core_features, non_functional_requirements, testing_strategy, deployment_instructions, reference_documentation, success_criteria
XML well-formed with proper nesting and all tags closed
Frontmatter complete with all required fields: project_name, generated_date, feature_count=67, prd_source, workflow_version
Feature IDs sequential from FEATURE_001 to FEATURE_067 with some extended features (FEATURE_011_EXTENDED, FEATURE_012_EXTENDED) which are logical extensions

notes: Total 67 features maps to 33 FRs + 34 NFRs = 67 requirements
Some features are extended versions (FEATURE_011_EXTENDED for FR-2.1 extended directory structure, FEATURE_012_EXTENDED for FR-3.1 extended skill stubs)
NFRs captured both as dedicated features (e.g., FEATURE_034 for NFR-1.1) and in non_functional_requirements section

well_covered_requirements.reason: Most critical security requirement with comprehensive 4-layer defense, specific detection rate targets (≥99.5%), Jorge's adversarial testing, false negative tracking, and quarterly validation. Detailed verification criteria across functional/technical/integration dimensions.

Blocking requirement for all GitHub operations with pre-flight validation script, clear authentication check, blocking mechanism, manual override with logging, and integration into autonomous agent startup. Critical for preventing wrong account usage.

Sophisticated bounded retry logic with 3-attempt strategy (standard → simplified → minimal), detailed logging specification (JSON format with all context), 30-min hard timeout, and integration with progress tracking. Prevents infinite loops.

Voice input system with comprehensive failure handling (5 scenarios: no mic, Whisper missing, poor audio, silence, manual fallback), confidence scoring, seamless fallback UX, and validation of Henry's aha moment. User-centric design.

Security metric with precise detection rate target (≥99.5% detection, ≤0.5% false negative, ≤5% false positive), baseline test suite (~100 cases), Jorge's 20+ adversarial scenarios, quarterly validation, and documented known gaps with improvement plan.

recommendations: ✅ EXCELLENT COVERAGE: All 67 requirements (33 FRs + 34 NFRs) are fully covered with comprehensive feature specifications.

✅ STRONG TRACEABILITY: Every PRD requirement maps 1:1 to app_spec.txt features with complete acceptance criteria, verification criteria (functional/technical/integration), dependencies, and constraints.

✅ COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION: Each feature includes detailed verification criteria across three dimensions: functional (user-facing), technical (implementation quality), integration (system interactions).
✅ AUTONOMOUS READINESS: app_spec.txt provides sufficient detail for autonomous agent implementation with 67 features, each having clear acceptance criteria, verification steps, and dependencies.

✅ SECURITY EMPHASIS: Critical security requirements (FR-5.1, NFR-1.1, FR-1.4) have exceptional detail including specific metrics (≥99.5% detection rate), multi-layer defense strategies, and adversarial testing protocols.
✅ PHASE CLARITY: Features clearly marked with phase (MVP-Day-0 through Phase-2) enabling phased implementation and prioritization.

✅ TESTING STRATEGY: Comprehensive testing strategy section includes 5 test types (unit, integration, security, aha moment validation, performance), quality gates (pre-commit, PR, autonomous agent, MVP complete), and test data management.

✅ DEPLOYMENT READINESS: Detailed deployment instructions with 4 phases (Day 0 foundation, Day 1-2 autonomous build, Day 3 human completion, Days 4-5 buffer), validation checkpoints, rollback strategy, and monitoring points.

✅ SUCCESS CRITERIA: Quantified success criteria across feature completion (60-70% autonomous target), quality metrics (≥99.5% secret detection, 80% test coverage, zero critical failures), user validation (4 aha moments), performance (< 2s response time), and operational metrics (99% workflow reliability, <$10/month MVP cost).
✅ REFERENCE DOCUMENTATION: Complete reference section with 8 internal documents, 7 external resources, and 10-term glossary providing autonomous agent with necessary context.

⚠️ EXTENDED FEATURES: Two extended features (FEATURE_011_EXTENDED, FEATURE_012_EXTENDED) provide implementation details beyond base requirements. This is acceptable for autonomous implementation but should be documented as 'implementation detail' extensions of base FRs.

⚠️ DUAL COVERAGE: Some NFRs are covered both as dedicated features (e.g., FEATURE_034 for NFR-1.1) AND in the non_functional_requirements section. This provides redundancy which is good for autonomous agents but should be clarified as intentional dual representation.
✅ NO GAPS FOUND: Zero requirements are missing, partially covered, or inadequately specified. The coverage is complete and implementation-ready.
